subject: Education
title: Cuba's Literacy Revolution: Zero to Hero
description: A micro-lesson that makes Cuba's Literacy Revolution: Zero to Hero usable.

hook.text: In 1961, Cuba sent 250,000 volunteers into the countryside. Their mission: teach every Cuban to read in one year.

buildup.text: Before the revolution, rural Cuba had a 40% illiteracy rate. Many farmers had never held a book.

discovery.text: Teenagers as young as 14 became teachers. They lived with families, taught by lamplight, and used a single primer.

twist.text: The campaign succeeded â€” illiteracy dropped to 4%. But critics say it also spread political propaganda.

climax.text: Cuba proved mass literacy is possible with political will. The debate is what you teach people to read.

punchline.text: They taught a nation to read. What it read was another story.

quiz.question: What was Cuba's illiteracy rate before the 1961 campaign?
